value.title: Handling deletes within Incremental Refresh in Power BI
value.excerpt: Are you using Incremental Refresh in Power BI? Are you stuck with how to handle deletes? Patrick has a great technique you can use to not only handle deletes, but also more easily handle updates with your partitions.  Download sample: https://guyinacu.be/handledeletessample  游닉 Become a member: https://guyinacu.be/membership

value.title: How the Power BI Data Region is selected
value.excerpt: In this video, I look at how the Power BI data region is selected. This is the what you see when you go to About Power BI and see "Your data is stored in". You should take care to make sure this is where the majority of users you are before anyone signs up for Office 365, Power BI or other Microsoft

value.title: OData Differences within Power BI and how to refresh your data!
value.excerpt: Last week we looked at the O365 Bubble and how we use Authentication to go in and out.  This week we show it in action!  We will look at one of the limitations to the existing Power BI service and how we can actually use the new Power BI Preview service to refresh data from an OData feed using oAuth

value.title: Power BI Auditing
value.excerpt: In this video, I look at the Power BI Auditing feature that was made available a few weeks ago. I show how to turn it on and how to search. This can be helpful with understanding who is doing what within your organization.  Offical Docs: https://powerbi.microsoft.com/en-us/documentation/powerbi-admin-auditing/

value.title: Power BI For Report Consumers
value.excerpt: In this video, we look at Power BI for report consumers. Those folks that maybe don't author reports, but just view reports within Power BI. We introduce some basic Power BI concepts and introduce you to areas of the Power BI service to get you familiar with the portal.  LET'S CONNECT!  Guy in a Cube

value.title: Power BI Paginated Reports: Visualizing Data

value.title: Power BI Tutorial: How to Sign up

value.title: Power BI User lookup with the gateway using Active Directory
value.excerpt: In this video, Adam looks at how you can use Active Directory custom attributes for the user lookup with the Power BI Gateway. This can be used for both Analysis Services mapping and the Kerberos SSO with DirectQuery connections. value.title: Row-Level Security in Power BI - Revisited

value.title: Setting default values using COALESCE in DAX
value.excerpt: Learn how to get default values using the DAX COALESCE function instead of IF statements. A great way to avoid BLANK in Power BI!  Documentation: https://docs.microsoft.com/dax/coalesce-function-dax  SQLBI.com article:  https://sql.bi/659297   游닉 Become a member: https://guyinacu.be/membership   *******************

value.title: Slicer Restatement in Power BI
value.excerpt: In this video, Patrick looks at a small feature called slicer restatement in Power BI. This feature will help you to determine what was selected in a slicer. While this feature was added back in April 2018, we are betting that most folks don't know slicer restatement.  LET'S CONNECT!  Guy in a Cube --

value.title: Using different languages with the Power BI site
value.excerpt: I look at how your browser languages affect what is displayed. This all comes down to your browsers and the language settings within. Different browsers are configured differently. Fiddler can show you what your language order is.  SUBSCRIBE! https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCFp1vaKzpfvoGai0vE5VJ0w?sub_confirmation=1

value.title: What Does Power BI Cost? (Including Power BI Report Server)
value.excerpt: What does Power BI cost? Adam has a lot of discussions around that. He will break down the Power BI cost and covers licenses, Power BI Premium and including Power BI Report Server and more! If you have ever asked yourself "What does Power BI cost?", this video is for you.  Power BI Pricing: https://powerbi.microsoft.com/pricing/
